intro: Monanthotaxis caesia, commonly known as the white-flowered strobilanthes, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub with opposite, ovate leaves that have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences and are often visited by bees and other pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
